H0.text: Who became leader of the British Conservative Party in July 1965. Reginald Maudling

H1.text: Who became leader of the British Conservative Party in July 1965. Iain Macleod

H2.text: Who became leader of the British Conservative Party in July 1965. Quintin Hogg

H3.text: Who became leader of the British Conservative Party in July 1965. Ted Heath

A4.text: Heath unexpectedly won the party's leadership contest in July 1965, gaining 150 votes to Reginald Maudling's 133 and Enoch Powell's 15.

A5.text: Reginald Maudling received 133 votes in the July 1965 Conservative leadership contest, finishing second to Heath.
